title: Critical Minerals in Sedimentary Systems
description: Exploring and characterizing critical mineral resources in sedimentary basins to promote sustainable development.

title: COâ‚‚ Storage Efficiency in Sedimentary Basins
description: Assessing storage capacity, with a focus on how multiscale heterogeneity affects long-term gas storage efficiency.

title: Digital Geosciences and Data-Driven Workflows
description: Using AI and automation in geoscientific data to improve understanding of geological processes and tackle complex real-world challenges.

title: Reservoir Quality and Characterization
description: Integrating petrographic, petrophysical, and geological workflows to evaluate reservoir quality in hydrocarbon systems and aquifers.

title: Automated Mineralogy Applications
description: Using automated mineralogy and innovative workflows to quantify mineral phases, textures, and diagenesis.

title: Bioturbation and Burrow-Modified Reservoirs
description: Quantifying how bioturbation, burrow networks, and ichnofabrics alter permeability architecture, flow pathways, and reservoir quality in carbonate and mixed siliciclastic systems.

title: Unconventional Tight Sandstone Reservoirs
description: Characterizing Paleozoic tight-gas sandstones using core description, petrography, petrophysics, and geochemical proxies to understand controls on porosity, permeability, and producibility.
